meanings.def: to fasten or join one thing to another
examples: attach something I attach a copy of my notes for your information.
A copy of his document is attached as Appendix 3 at the end of this book.
attach something to something Attach the coupon to the front of your letter.
(figurative) They have attached a number of conditions to the agreement (= said that the conditions must be part of the agreement)

meanings.def: to send an electronic document with an email
examples: I attach a copy of the spreadsheet.
I am attaching the image as a PDF file.

meanings.def: to believe that something is important or worth thinking about
examples: attach importance, significance, value, weight to something I attach great importance to this research.
I wouldn't attach too much weight to these findings.

meanings.def: to join somebody for a time, sometimes when you are not welcome or have not been invited
examples: He attached himself to me at the party and I couldn't get rid of him.

meanings.def: to be connected with somebody/something; to connect something to something
examples: attach to somebody/something No one is suggesting that any health risks attach to this product.
attach something to somebody/something This does not attach any blame to you.
be attached to something Unfortunately, there is still a stigma attached to mental illness.
